title: 3 face federal charges after DEA finds 13 pounds of meth under Lincoln home and 2 more pounds in Norfolk
title_page: 3 face federal charges after DEA finds 13 pounds of meth under Lincoln home and 2 more pounds in Norfolk
maintext:
3 face federal charges after DEA finds 13 pounds of meth under Lincoln home and 2 more pounds in Norfolk
Three people face federal charges after investigators found 13 pounds of methamphetamine under a home in Lincoln and two pounds in a home in Norfolk.
According to court records, a 47-year-old woman and a 27-year-old man, both of Lincoln, and a 41-year-old Norfolk man have been charged with conspiracy to distribute and possession with intent to distribute more than 500 grams of methamphetamine.
On Tuesday, agents with the Drug Enforcement Administration served federal search warrants at the woman’s Lincoln home, where they said they found the 13 pounds of meth hidden underneath the building. Searches of the Lincoln man’s home found a large amount of cash, officials said. At the Norfolk man’s house, officers found the meth and a large amount of cash.
In an affidavit, Jarrett Swearingen, a special agent with the DEA, said the investigation began in February 2017 and revealed that the Lincoln woman traveled to California at least three times, bringing back methamphetamine that she and the two men distributed in Nebraska.
